notes: The Maple Leafs announced that Pacioretty left Tuesday's (Oct. 22) game with a lower-body injury.
Benson will not play on Tuesday (Oct. 22) against Dallas, Paul Hamilton of WGR Sports Radio 550 reports.
Slafkovsky is out on Tuesday (Oct. 22) versus the New York Rangers and will be re-evaluated in a week.
Karlsson will not return on Tuesday but has a possibility on Friday vs. Ottawa.
Head coach Travis Green said Monday that Perron is away from the team due to a personal matter, TSN 1200 Ottawa reports.
Duclair is expected to be out long-term but not miss the rest of the regular season.
Gadjovich is OUT on Tuesday (Oct. 22) against Minnesota, per Jameson Olive of the Panthers' official site.
Toropchenko is out for Tuesday's (Oct. 22) game against Winnipeg.
Guhle will not be in the lineup to face the Rangers on Tuesday (Oct. 22).
Motte is out for Tuesday's (Oct. 22) game against the Islanders.

Hartman is out on Tuesday (Oct. 22) versus the Florida Panthers.
Anderson is out for Tuesday's (Oct. 22) game against Vancouver.

Johnson is without a timeline to return and expected to be out long-term, per Aaron Portzline of The Athletic.

The Los Angeles Kings placed G Darcy Kuemper on injured reserve.
Ullmark will remain out on Tuesday's (Oct. 22) Game in Utah and is still considered day-to-day.

Olofsson is week-to-week, per Danny Webster of the Las Vegas Review-Journal.

G Joseph Woll is participating in a full practice on Friday (Oct.18), Dave McCarthy of NHL.com reports.

The Pittsburgh Penguins placed F Blake Lizotte on injured reserve.

Grosenick underwent successful surgery to repair a torn anterior cruciate ligament in his right knee and will not play this season. He is expected to make a full recovery and be ready for the start of the 2025-26 season.
